result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek J Defenbaugh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.

Mainain employment and /or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Derek J Defenbaugh in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray for Attorney Jess Martinez.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Mcmurray requests to proceed with plea an sentencing. Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1 and count #3. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of counts #1 and #3. Count #2 is dismissed and read in. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Mcmurray makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT#1:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

30 DAYS HUBER 

TERM OF PROBATION: 2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

COSTS:  $243.00 + $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bond posted, remainder paid as a condition of probation)

COUNT#3:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

90 DAYS HUBER 	***CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT #1***

TERM OF PROBATION: 2 YEARS	***CONCURRENT TO COUNT #1***

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

CONDITION TIME: 40 days-Non-working hours with standard release conditions, STAYED, for use of agent with court permission. 

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Defendant Derek J Defenbaugh in court with Attorney Daniel Mcmurray for Attorney Jess Martinez.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED on amended complaint.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 24, 2015 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Derek J Defenbaugh in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray for Atty Jess Martinez.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Mcmurray requests a further plea/sentencing date to continue negotiations with the State. Court will adjourn.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Derek J Defenbaugh in court with Attorney Daniel McMurray for Attorney Jess Martinez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney McMurray requests an adjourned date for plea and sentencing.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derek J Defenbaugh in court with Attorney Daniel McMurray for Attorney Jess Martinez.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney McMurray requests a plea and sentence date.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Derek J Defenbaugh in court, in custody, with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
  Hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.
